summary_comment: Professor Jones delivers high-quality instruction, covering engaging and interesting topics while maintaining a humorous and inclusive classroom atmosphere. Jones demonstrates a strong commitment to student learning, actively seeking feedback and making immediate improvements. Students highly recommend future classes with this professor.

Ratings.comment: I really enjoyed Mx. Jones's class. The topics we covered were so interesting and Mx. Jones is super funny. They had a class where we just provided feedback and changed the things that we did not like immediately. They really care about whether or not students are learning. I would love to take another class from Mx. Jones in the future!

summary_comment: This professor is known for his rigorous grading standards, with students warning that grades can be significantly lower than expected. The course is widely regarded as very challenging.

Ratings.comment: just run, u cannot imagine how low he will grade your work.
This course is very difficult, run

summary_comment: Professor Applegate offers high-quality instruction, combining extensive required readings with engaging discussion-based classes. She is known for her flexibility and approachability, making the learning experience accessible. Her deep knowledge of the subject matter ensures that the content is both informative and enriching.

Ratings.comment: There are long "required" readings outside of class. Class is mostly discussion based about the material you read. Applegate is really flexible and easy to get along with. She also knows her stuff so it's pretty informational.

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Feminist Perspectives on Addiction, Service Learning

summary_comment: The professor's teaching quality is poor, as evidenced by the limited grading criteria that cap students' highest possible grade at a B, despite their performance. Many students express deep dissatisfaction, with one stating they regret taking the class and vow never to enroll in another course taught by this instructor.

Ratings.comment: You are graded by only 3 assignments where, even if you do the best work ever, you will receive a B or lower. I regret staying in this class and will never take another class from this instructor.

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Topics in Women's, Gender and Sexuality Studies

summary_comment: Hannah is a kind professor who assigns relatively few graded tasks but requires extensive reading. While her grading can be strict, students who excel at writing may find it easier to earn high grades. However, her class frequently cancels due to her absence.

Ratings.comment: Hannah is a decent professor. While she is a harsh grader on papers, and never gave me feedback although I asked for it multiple times, there are only 4 assignments in the whole class. Tons of readings though. Hannah is a very kind person though and if you're a good writer you will get an easy A. She also cancels class like once a week.

summary_comment: The professor is described as lazy and unreliable, frequently missing assignment deadlines and failing to respond promptly to emails. Despite this, the class is perceived as easy, focusing mainly on readings and quizzes with understanding policies for late assignments. Lectures are simple and straightforward, though often delivered without timely posting of materials.

Ratings.comment: Professor was lazy. Assignments were almost never posted on time, and she wouldn't respond to emails regarding it until after the due date had passed. Overall the class is very easy if you want a GE where you don't have to do too much work. But as far as I can tell, she is just assigning readings and quizzes and can't even do that on time. Annoying

There are a lot of assignments that have about 2-3 things to read. There are also discussion board posts weekly, but the professor is very understanding when it comes to late assignments. The lectures are also very simple and easy to understand, and each lecture has sources and videos to watch to better understand the material.
